SENT.plain: We report on a 12-year-old boy with neurofibromatosis type 1 who suffered a transient ischemic attack
Angiography revealed occlusion of intracranial arteries, moyamoya vessels and leptomeningeal collaterals
The conventional T2-weighted and the diffusion-weighted MRI images demonstrated no pathology

Dynamic first-pass postgadolinium T2* perfusion-weighted MRI depicted altered hemodynamics in the vascular territory of the left middle cerebral artery, which defined this region as ischemic tissue at risk
The patient suffered a repeat transient ischemic attack 5 days later
